title: Is Senate required to wait for articles of impeachment?
description: CNN legal analyst Elie Honig joins Ana Cabrera to discuss the next steps in the impeachment of President Donald Trump.

title: Here's what the White House press secretary has to say about not holding press briefings
description: White House press secretary Stephanie Grisham has rebuffed a recent CNN opinion piece from 13 former White House press secretaries, foreign service and military officials arguing for the return of daily press briefings.

title: Rapper arrested for alleged cocaine possession
description: The rapper Trick Daddy was arrested in Florida on Saturday on a cocaine possession charge, according to the Miami-Dade County Clerk of Courts.

title: Conservative 'Moms' group condemns Burger King for using 'd-word' in ad
description: Activist conservative group One Million Moms is taking aim at Burger King for using what it calls the "d-word" in a commercial promoting the non-meat Impossible Whopper.

title: Patriots' Edelman arrested in Beverly Hills
description: New England Patriots wide receiver Julian Edelman was arrested in Beverly Hills, California, on Saturday night after allegedly jumping on a vehicle and causing damage, according to a police spokeswoman.

title: Aguero sets English Premier League scoring record
description: Is Sergio Aguero now the finest international goalscorer to ever grace the English Premier League?

title: 30 seconds altered the course of a country forever
description: Ten years ago today a massive earthquake struck Haiti, transforming capital city Port-au-Prince into a nightmare in seconds. Some 70,000 people would be buried within a week's time. Hundreds of thousands more would follow them to the grave.

title: Stelter slams Fox News anchor's missed opportunity
description: CNN's Brian Stelter breaks down the Fox News interview where President Donald Trump claims four embassies were under threat from Iran.

title: America's new favorite restaurants are Wawa, Sheetz and 7-Eleven
description: In "Vacation," National Lampoon's 1980s classic, Chevy Chase jokes, "I'm so hungry. I could eat a sandwich from a gas station."

title: '1917' dethrones 'Star Wars' at the box office
description: A war movie once again topped the box office this weekend. However, this one was set in the trenches of World War I rather than a galaxy far, far away.

title: Iran's sole female Olympic medalist says she's defected
description: Iran's sole female Olympic medalist Kimia Alizadeh announced that she has permanently left her country for Europe.

title: Libya's renegade general declares ceasefire, ending nine-month attack on capital
description: Libya's renegade Gen. Khalifa Haftar has declared a ceasefire, ending a nine-month campaign to seize the capital, Tripoli.

title: A royal showdown looms over Harry and Meghan's decision to go it alone
Iranian protesters take to streets after Tehran admits Ukrainian plane was unintentionally shot down
Can wearing the same tux to every award show put a dent in fashion's carbon footprint?
description: Celebrities want you to stop shopping? Easy for them to say.

title: More than 20 million people under flood watch after killer storms power through Midwest, East
description: More than 20 million people were under a flood watch Saturday as storms responsible for at least eight deaths cut through the Midwest and Southeast.

title: Hockey analyst Jeremy Roenick apologizes for making 'inappropriate comments' about his co-workers
description: Hockey analyst Jeremy Roenick issued an apology on Twitter Saturday weeks after NBC Sports indefinitely suspended him for making inappropriate comments about his coworkers.

title: Why does Meghan get all the blame?
description: Prince Harry and Meghan, The Duchess of Sussex, have announced they're stepping back from — and essentially quitting — their roles as senior members of the royal family. As part of that move, they'll spend some of their time in North America and "work to become financially independent." Who knew that was even an option?

title: More than a dozen Saudi servicemen to be expelled from US
description: More than a dozen Saudi servicemen training at US military installations will be expelled from the United States after a review that followed the deadly shooting last month at a Naval Air Station in Pensacola, Florida, multiple sources told CNN.

title: Olympians will sleep on these unique beds
description: The athletes competing in the 2020 Olympic Summer Games in Tokyo will be sleeping on bed frames made of cardboard and mattresses made of plastic to reduce the event's carbon footprint, according to organizers.

title: Iowa Poll: Iowa voters divided over impeachment
description: Iowa registered voters are divided over whether the House of Representatives made the right move in impeaching President Donald Trump and a plurality say he should not be removed from office, according to a new CNN/Des Moines Register/Mediacom poll.
